paper.title: Dialogue structures for virtual worlds

paper.abstract: We describe a software architecture for virtual worlds, built on a base of multiple processes communicating through a central event-driven user interface management system. The virtual worldu0027s behavior is specified by a dialogue composed of modular subdialogues or rule sets. In order to achieve high flexibility, device remappability and reusability, the rule sets should be written as independent modules, each encapsulating its own state. Each should be designed according to its purpose in a conceptual hierarchy: it can transform a specific device into a generic device, or transform a generic device into an interaction technique, or, at the top level, map interaction techniques to actions.
